Tower Hamlets is in the 20 local areas in the country with the highest rates of destitution. 8.14 The 2022 local area statistics revealed that 15,385 (26.7%) children in Tower Hamlets were living in relative low-income families and 12,522 (21.8%) children in Tower Hamlets were living in absolute low-income families before housing costs - this is the second highest proportion among London Boroughs after the City of London (The City of London has a significantly smaller population size than any other local authority area given its location, commercial focus, and geographical area).
